Comments_List: Learned a lot about democracy and democratic erosion I didn't know before. Good for getting a sense of the field.
I think the graduate students could have been given more journal articles / academic papers in addition to the books

For the most part, the readings were engaging, though I would recommend a slightly wider set of perspectives, both from the right (not necessarily far-right but conservative takes on democracy and erosion) and from the more critical left. I think this would enliven discussion by giving students the chance to think from different points of view. Also, I think it would be worth talking a bit more about countries outside North America and Europe (particularly India, which I don't think we mentioned) in future iterations to put backsliding in its global context. With all that said, I really enjoyed the course.
